itemDescription: English cricketer and rugby union footballer (1879-1950)

wikipedia_page.main: Edward Ivo Medhurst Barrett,   (22 June 1879 – 10 July 1950) was an English Army officer, cricketer and rugby union international. A right-handed batsman who was considered one of the finest and hardest hitters of his day, he played first-class cricket for Hampshire, mainly between 1896 and 1912, with additional matches in 1920 and 1925.

response: *Edward Barrett – played for Hampshire and the MCC between 1896 and 1925.Edward Barrett at CricketArchive

response: Edward Barrett (11 June 1846 – 23 December 1923) was an English cricketer.
Barrett's son Edward Barrett, Jr. played first-class cricket for Hampshire and the Marylebone Cricket Club.
